item.title: SotMAsia and SotM Bangladesh are looking for enthusiastic Campus Ambassadors to help make the event a grand success. Read more at Shawan Shariar's diary https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Sawan%20Shariar/diary/404290 #OpenStreetMap #OSM #SotMAsia @sotmasia

OpenStreetMap is a map that everyone can edit and improve, and that's how we've created the best map of the world. ğŸ˜ ğŸ—º ğŸ’ª ğŸ¥‡ Alas, some people just want to vandalise things ğŸ˜­. If you've seen weird things on the map (e.g. lots of crossing white lines), that could be vandalism. Here's what to do if you see this: https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/have-you-spotted-vandalism-on-openstreetmap-org/114684 with thanks to @SomeoneElse. #OpenStreetMap #OSM #OSMVandalism #Vandalism

OSMF at the UN Maps conference! OpenStreetMap Foundation board member Sarah Hoffmann recently joined the 3rd annual UNMaps conference in Valencia, Spain to present about the OpenStreetMap project and participate in a panel discussion about crowd-sourced geodata. read more: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2024/06/18/openstreetmap-at-the-unmaps-conference-2024/ #OpenStreetMap #OSM #UN "Crowdsourcing Geospatial Information" | Panelists from left to right: (host) Michael Montani (UNMappers; (panelists) Benjamin Herfort (HeiGIT), Sarah Hoffmann (OSMF), Sam Colchester (HOT).

Looking to get in touch with other #LGBTQ+ #OpenStreetMap people? Have you heard of MapBeks <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/MapBeks> or RainbOSM <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/RainbOSM> @rainbosm? Happy Pride ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ and Happy Mapping ğŸ—º! #OpenStreetMap #OSM #Pride #PrideMonth #PrideMonth2024

The main way to store #LGBTQ+ aspect in #OpenStreetMap is with the `lgbtq` tag. ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ `lgbtq=primary` is for locations which cater to an exclusively or predominantly LGBTQ+ audience, either by the managers running it that way, or by overwhelming convention. Subtags (`lgbtq:*=*`) can be used for finer details. Read more on the OSM Wiki ğŸ“ <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:lgbtq> Happy Pride ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ and Happy Mapping! ğŸ—º ğŸ™‚ #OSM #LGB #LGBT #LGBTQ #PrideMonth #Pride #PrideMonth2024

Today (3 June) is #WorldBicycleDay! ğŸš²ğŸš² #OpenStreetMap has always had lots of cycling enthusiasts, mappers, cartographers and devs! ğŸš² JFK said â€œNothing compares to the simple pleasure of riding a bikeâ€, we agree but would include â€œor OSM mappingâ€. ğŸ™‚ğŸš²ğŸ—ºï¸ğŸ” 2 #bicycle maps are visible on OSM.org: OpenCycleMap <https://osm.org/#layers=C> and CyclOSM <https://osm.org/#layers=Y> To find out how to map #bike features, check out the #OSM wiki: <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Bicycle>

What's some of your favourite photos or images of #OpenStreetMap from the last 20 years? ğŸ™‚ğŸ¤”ğŸ“¸ Help the OSM CWG collect images for the OSM's 20th Birthday party. ğŸ™‚ğŸ™‚ suggest your favorites on the OSM forum: ğŸ’¬ https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/favorite-photos-and-quotes-about-osm-over-the-last-20-years/113968 NB: Interesting, CC licenced, images can be uploaded to the OSM wiki: ğŸ“ <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org>! #OpenStreetMap #OSM

ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ Happy Pride from OpenStreetMap! ğŸ™‚ ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ LGBTQ+ people are mappers, and hackers, and cartographers, and have always been a part of the OpenStreetMap community. A diverse community where people treat each other with respect has more potential contributors and more sources for ideas, and will create a better map. https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/w/images/thumb/b/ba/2019_v1_OSM_Rainbow.svg/768px-2019_v1_OSM_Rainbow.svg.png #Pride #LGBTQ #LGBTQ+ #Queer #OpenStreetMap #OSM #gischat

This Knight Frank (KF) map offers a detailed look at Indonesiaâ€™s infrastructure, with a particular focus on Jakarta. It includes data on various property types, facilities, and key infrastructure elements such as toll roads, airports and seaports, facilitating comprehensive urban and regional planning and analysis. (source: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/17225 ) https://kfmap.asia/maps?lat=-6.185325100668675&lng=106.82867252952241&z=12&sec=1,2,3,5,11,14,15,17,18,22,23,41,42,43,44

OSM data powers new and ongoing research all over the world. For example, The United States Census Bureau has developed a socioeconomic profile of the commuters affected by the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge, in Baltimore, based on OSM data and OSRM. https://www.census.gov/library/stories/2024/05/key-bridge-commuters.html
What questions do you have for the OSMF Board about 2024 and beyond? https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2024/05/21/highlights-from-the-osmf-board-spring-2024-meeting

(source: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/17225 ) What do you think? What's your experience? https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Ohene123/diary/404100

Four #OpenStreetMap projects are taking part in Google's Summer of Code this year. ğŸ™‚ Read more on: OSM Wiki: ğŸ“ https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/2024/Accepted_projects OSM Forum ğŸ’¬ https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/four-projects-accepted-for-google-summer-of-code-2024/112588 #GSoC #GoogleSummerOfCode #SummerOfCode #OSM

NINE DAYS LEFT to submit to the OSM Science 2024 track in Nairobi this autumn. The deadline is 10 May 2024. Submit here: https://pretalx.com/state-of-the-map-2024-academic-track/cfp Learn more here: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2024/04/04/sotm-2024-call-for-academic-track-abstracts/ @sotm #SotM #StateOfTheMap #OpenStreetMap

Today, 1 May, is International Workers' Day! ğŸŒ¹ Your local trade union can be mapped in #OpenStreetMap with `office=union`: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:office%3Dunion. The OpenStreetMap project strives to make the best, freely licenced map of the world for everyone, available for free. We provide the alternative to the handful of massive global corporations. #OSMF is the democratic org supporting #OSM. Join today: https://supporting.openstreetmap.org/#Membership-Categories #OSMFMembershipCampaign #LabourDay #InternationalWorkersDay
ğŸ“ New OSM blog post: THREE reasons to join the OpenStreetMap foundation in April: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2024/04/11/three-great-reasons-to-join-the-osm-foundation-as-a-member/

Today's the UNESCO #WorldBookDay! #OpenStreetMap can help you find books. We map libraries <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:amenity%3Dlibrary> (incl. little free libraries <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:amenity%3Dpublic_bookcase>), and bookshops <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:shop%3Dbooks>. Several books have been published about #OSM: <https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Books> We want OSM to be used, so if you need a map for your book, we have very generous & liberal attribution requirements: https://osmfoundation.org/wiki/Licence/Attribution_Guidelines (and can show where to buy your stationary https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:shop%3Dstationery )
â° Today is the last day to apply to present at #StateOfTheMap (@sotm), the annual #OpenStreetMap global conference, in Nairobi, Kenya! https://2024.stateofthemap.org/calls/general/ #OSM #sotm2024

Would you like to see your post, project, mapping party, community photo, diary, mapping data viz or other #OSM story on the official OSM social media channels? Here are some guidelines for requesting Communications Working Group support: https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/update-on-how-to-request-social-media-posts-or-other-cwg-support/111482 #OpenStreetMap
